question: Find countries with the highest volatility (standard deviation) in unemployment rate from 2010 to 2020
ground_truth_sql:
SELECT c.country_name, 
       AVG(g.value) AS avg_unemployment,
       COUNT(*) AS data_points,
       (SUM(g.value * g.value) / COUNT(*)) - (AVG(g.value) * AVG(g.value)) AS variance
FROM gem_observations g
JOIN countries c ON g.country_id = c.country_id
JOIN indicators i ON g.indicator_id = i.indicator_id
WHERE i.indicator_name = 'Unemployment Rate'
AND g.year BETWEEN 2010 AND 2020
GROUP BY c.country_name
HAVING COUNT(*) >= 5
ORDER BY variance DESC
LIMIT 10
original_question: Find countries with the highest volatility (standard deviation) in unemployment rate from 2010 to 2020

question: Calculate the cumulative sum of tax revenue over years for Australia
ground_truth_sql:
WITH yearly_tax AS (
    SELECT g.year, g.value AS tax_revenue
    FROM gfs_observations g
    JOIN countries c ON g.country_id = c.country_id
    JOIN sectors s ON g.sector_id = s.sector_id
    JOIN indicators i ON g.indicator_id = i.indicator_id
    WHERE c.country_name = 'Australia'
    AND s.sector_name = 'General government'
    AND i.indicator_name = 'Taxes, Transactions (cash basis of recording), Cash basis'
    AND g.transformation = 'Percent of GDP'
)
SELECT year, tax_revenue,
       SUM(tax_revenue) OVER (ORDER BY year) AS cumulative_tax
FROM yearly_tax
ORDER BY year
original_question: Calculate the cumulative sum of tax revenue over years for Australia

question: Compare government expenditure between central and local government for Brazil over 2015-2022
ground_truth_sql:
SELECT g.year,
       SUM(CASE WHEN s.sector_name = 'Central government including social security' THEN g.value ELSE 0 END) AS central_govt,
       SUM(CASE WHEN s.sector_name = 'Local Government' THEN g.value ELSE 0 END) AS local_govt,
       SUM(CASE WHEN s.sector_name = 'Central government including social security' THEN g.value ELSE 0 END) -
       SUM(CASE WHEN s.sector_name = 'Local Government' THEN g.value ELSE 0 END) AS difference
FROM gfs_observations g
JOIN countries c ON g.country_id = c.country_id
JOIN sectors s ON g.sector_id = s.sector_id
JOIN indicators i ON g.indicator_id = i.indicator_id
WHERE c.country_name = 'Brazil'
AND i.indicator_name = 'Expenditure, Transactions (cash basis of recording), Cash basis'
AND g.transformation = 'Percent of GDP'
AND g.year BETWEEN 2015 AND 2022
GROUP BY g.year
ORDER BY g.year
original_question: Compare government expenditure between central and local government for Brazil over 2015-2022

question: Rank countries by their average GDP growth from 2015 to 2020, showing only the top 15
ground_truth_sql:
WITH gdp_by_year AS (
    SELECT c.country_name, g.year, g.value AS gdp
    FROM gem_observations g
    JOIN countries c ON g.country_id = c.country_id
    JOIN indicators i ON g.indicator_id = i.indicator_id
    WHERE i.indicator_name = 'GDP at market prices'
    AND i.unit = 'constant 2010 US$, millions'
    AND g.year BETWEEN 2014 AND 2020
),
growth_rates AS (
    SELECT country_name, year,
           (gdp - LAG(gdp) OVER (PARTITION BY country_name ORDER BY year)) / 
           LAG(gdp) OVER (PARTITION BY country_name ORDER BY year) * 100 AS growth_rate
    FROM gdp_by_year
)
SELECT country_name, AVG(growth_rate) AS avg_growth_rate,
       RANK() OVER (ORDER BY AVG(growth_rate) DESC) AS rank
FROM growth_rates
WHERE growth_rate IS NOT NULL
GROUP BY country_name
ORDER BY avg_growth_rate DESC
LIMIT 15
original_question: Rank countries by their average GDP growth from 2015 to 2020, showing only the top 15

question: Find the top 5 countries by combined GFS and GEM data availability (total observations)
ground_truth_sql:
WITH combined AS (
    SELECT country_id, 'GFS' AS source FROM gfs_observations
    UNION ALL
    SELECT country_id, 'GEM' AS source FROM gem_observations
)
SELECT c.country_name, 
       SUM(CASE WHEN source = 'GFS' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS gfs_obs,
       SUM(CASE WHEN source = 'GEM' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS gem_obs,
       COUNT(*) AS total_obs
FROM combined
JOIN countries c ON combined.country_id = c.country_id
GROUP BY c.country_name
ORDER BY total_obs DESC
LIMIT 5
original_question: Find the top 5 countries by combined GFS and GEM data availability (total observations)

question: Identify the year with the largest GDP drop for each major economy (US, China, Japan, Germany, UK) between 2008 and 2022
ground_truth_sql:
WITH gdp_changes AS (
    SELECT c.country_name, g.year, g.value AS gdp,
           g.value - LAG(g.value) OVER (PARTITION BY c.country_name ORDER BY g.year) AS gdp_change
    FROM gem_observations g
    JOIN countries c ON g.country_id = c.country_id
    JOIN indicators i ON g.indicator_id = i.indicator_id
    WHERE c.country_name IN ('United States', 'China', 'Japan', 'Germany', 'United Kingdom')
    AND i.indicator_name = 'GDP at market prices'
    AND i.unit = 'constant 2010 US$, millions'
    AND g.year BETWEEN 2008 AND 2022
),
ranked AS (
    SELECT country_name, year, gdp_change,
           ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY country_name ORDER BY gdp_change ASC) AS rn
    FROM gdp_changes
    WHERE gdp_change IS NOT NULL
)
SELECT country_name, year AS worst_year, gdp_change AS gdp_drop
FROM ranked
WHERE rn = 1
ORDER BY gdp_drop ASC
original_question: Identify the year with the largest GDP drop for each major economy (US, China, Japan, Germany, UK) between 2008 and 2022

question: Compare tax revenues as a percentage of GDP across countries with good data coverage (Singapore, Australia, Israel, South Africa, Chile) for 2020, ranking them from highest to lowest
ground_truth_sql:
WITH Tax_Revenue AS (
    SELECT 
        c.country_name,
        g.value AS tax_revenue_pct_gdp
    FROM gfs_observations g
    JOIN countries c ON g.country_id = c.country_id
    JOIN sectors s ON g.sector_id = s.sector_id
    JOIN indicators i ON g.indicator_id = i.indicator_id
    WHERE c.country_name IN ('Singapore', 'Australia', 'Israel', 'South Africa', 'Chile')
        AND g.year = 2020
        AND s.sector_name = 'General government'
        AND i.indicator_name = 'Taxes, Transactions (cash basis of recording), Cash basis'
        AND g.transformation = 'Percent of GDP'
),
Avg_Tax AS (
    SELECT AVG(tax_revenue_pct_gdp) AS avg_tax_revenue
    FROM Tax_Revenue
)
SELECT 
    t.country_name,
    t.tax_revenue_pct_gdp,
    a.avg_tax_revenue AS group_average,
    (t.tax_revenue_pct_gdp - a.avg_tax_revenue) AS difference_from_avg
FROM Tax_Revenue t
CROSS JOIN Avg_Tax a
ORDER BY t.tax_revenue_pct_gdp DESC
original_question: Compare tax revenues as a percentage of GDP across countries with good data coverage (Singapore, Australia, Israel, South Africa, Chile) for 2020, ranking them from highest to lowest

question: Show the year-over-year change in net lending/borrowing for Singapore's general government from 2015 to 2022, identifying years with deficits (negative values)
ground_truth_sql:
WITH Yearly_Values AS (
    SELECT 
        g.year,
        g.value AS current_value,
        LAG(g.value) OVER (ORDER BY g.year) AS previous_value
    FROM gfs_observations g
    JOIN countries c ON g.country_id = c.country_id
    JOIN sectors s ON g.sector_id = s.sector_id
    JOIN indicators i ON g.indicator_id = i.indicator_id
    WHERE c.country_name = 'Singapore'
        AND s.sector_name = 'General government'
        AND i.indicator_name = 'Net lending (+) / net borrowing (-), Transactions (cash basis of recording), Cash basis'
        AND g.transformation = 'Percent of GDP'
        AND g.year BETWEEN 2015 AND 2022
)
SELECT 
    year,
    current_value,
    previous_value,
    (current_value - previous_value) AS yoy_change,
    CASE 
        WHEN current_value < 0 THEN 'Deficit'
        ELSE 'Surplus'
    END AS fiscal_status
FROM Yearly_Values
WHERE previous_value IS NOT NULL
ORDER BY year
original_question: Show the year-over-year change in net lending/borrowing for Singapore's general government from 2015 to 2022, identifying years with deficits (negative values)

question: Calculate the correlation between government revenue and expenditure across all countries for 2019
ground_truth_sql:
WITH paired_data AS (
    SELECT c.country_name,
           SUM(CASE WHEN i.indicator_name LIKE '%Revenue%' THEN g.value ELSE 0 END) AS revenue,
           SUM(CASE WHEN i.indicator_name LIKE '%Expenditure%' THEN g.value ELSE 0 END) AS expenditure
    FROM gfs_observations g
    JOIN countries c ON g.country_id = c.country_id
    JOIN sectors s ON g.sector_id = s.sector_id
    JOIN indicators i ON g.indicator_id = i.indicator_id
    WHERE s.sector_name = 'General government'
    AND g.transformation = 'Percent of GDP'
    AND g.year = 2019
    GROUP BY c.country_name
    HAVING SUM(CASE WHEN i.indicator_name LIKE '%Revenue%' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) > 0
       AND SUM(CASE WHEN i.indicator_name LIKE '%Expenditure%' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) > 0
),
stats AS (
    SELECT 
        COUNT(*) AS n,
        SUM(revenue) AS sum_x,
        SUM(expenditure) AS sum_y,
        SUM(revenue * expenditure) AS sum_xy,
        SUM(revenue * revenue) AS sum_xx,
        SUM(expenditure * expenditure) AS sum_yy
    FROM paired_data
)
SELECT 
    n AS sample_size,
    (n * sum_xy - sum_x * sum_y) / 
    SQRT((n * sum_xx - sum_x * sum_x) * (n * sum_yy - sum_y * sum_y)) AS correlation
FROM stats
original_question: Calculate the correlation between government revenue and expenditure across all countries for 2019

question: Identify countries where total expenditure as percent of GDP for general government increased by more than 5 percentage points between 2019 and 2021
ground_truth_sql:
WITH Expenditure_By_Year AS (
    SELECT 
        c.country_name,
        SUM(CASE WHEN g.year = 2019 THEN g.value ELSE 0 END) AS exp_2019,
        SUM(CASE WHEN g.year = 2021 THEN g.value ELSE 0 END) AS exp_2021
    FROM gfs_observations g
    JOIN countries c ON g.country_id = c.country_id
    JOIN sectors s ON g.sector_id = s.sector_id
    JOIN indicators i ON g.indicator_id = i.indicator_id
    WHERE s.sector_name = 'General government'
        AND i.indicator_name = 'Expenditure, Transactions (cash basis of recording), Cash basis'
        AND g.transformation = 'Percent of GDP'
        AND g.year IN (2019, 2021)
    GROUP BY c.country_name
    HAVING SUM(CASE WHEN g.year = 2019 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) > 0
       AND SUM(CASE WHEN g.year = 2021 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) > 0
)
SELECT 
    country_name,
    exp_2019,
    exp_2021,
    (exp_2021 - exp_2019) AS change_pct_points
FROM Expenditure_By_Year
WHERE (exp_2021 - exp_2019) > 5
ORDER BY (exp_2021 - exp_2019) DESC
original_question: Identify countries where total expenditure as percent of GDP for general government increased by more than 5 percentage points between 2019 and 2021

question: Calculate the compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of GDP for India from 2010 to 2020
ground_truth_sql:
WITH gdp_endpoints AS (
    SELECT 
        MAX(CASE WHEN year = 2010 THEN value END) AS gdp_2010,
        MAX(CASE WHEN year = 2020 THEN value END) AS gdp_2020
    FROM gem_observations g
    JOIN countries c ON g.country_id = c.country_id
    JOIN indicators i ON g.indicator_id = i.indicator_id
    WHERE c.country_name = 'India'
    AND i.indicator_name = 'GDP at market prices'
    AND i.unit = 'constant 2010 US$, millions'
    AND g.year IN (2010, 2020)
)
SELECT gdp_2010, gdp_2020,
       (POWER(gdp_2020 / gdp_2010, 1.0/10) - 1) * 100 AS cagr_percent
FROM gdp_endpoints
WHERE gdp_2010 > 0 AND gdp_2020 > 0
original_question: Calculate the compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of GDP for India from 2010 to 2020

question: Find countries where government revenue consistently exceeded expenditure (surplus) every year from 2015 to 2020
ground_truth_sql:
WITH fiscal_balance AS (
    SELECT c.country_name, g.year,
           SUM(CASE WHEN i.indicator_name LIKE '%Revenue%' THEN g.value ELSE 0 END) AS revenue,
           SUM(CASE WHEN i.indicator_name LIKE '%Expenditure%' THEN g.value ELSE 0 END) AS expenditure
    FROM gfs_observations g
    JOIN countries c ON g.country_id = c.country_id
    JOIN sectors s ON g.sector_id = s.sector_id
    JOIN indicators i ON g.indicator_id = i.indicator_id
    WHERE s.sector_name = 'General government'
    AND g.transformation = 'Percent of GDP'
    AND g.year BETWEEN 2015 AND 2020
    GROUP BY c.country_name, g.year
    HAVING SUM(CASE WHEN i.indicator_name LIKE '%Revenue%' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) > 0
       AND SUM(CASE WHEN i.indicator_name LIKE '%Expenditure%' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) > 0
)
SELECT country_name, COUNT(*) AS years_with_data,
       SUM(CASE WHEN revenue > expenditure THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS surplus_years
FROM fiscal_balance
GROUP BY country_name
HAVING COUNT(*) >= 5 AND SUM(CASE WHEN revenue > expenditure THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) = COUNT(*)
ORDER BY country_name
original_question: Find countries where government revenue consistently exceeded expenditure (surplus) every year from 2015 to 2020

question: Find the country with the largest deterioration in net lending/borrowing (as percent of GDP) during 2019-2020
ground_truth_sql:
WITH balance AS (
    SELECT
        c.country_name,
        g.year,
        g.value AS net_lending_pct_gdp
    FROM gfs_observations g
    JOIN countries c ON g.country_id = c.country_id
    JOIN sectors s ON g.sector_id = s.sector_id
    JOIN indicators i ON g.indicator_id = i.indicator_id
    WHERE s.sector_name = 'General government'
        AND i.indicator_name = 'Net lending (+) / net borrowing (-), Transactions (cash basis of recording), Cash basis'
        AND g.transformation = 'Percent of GDP'
        AND g.year IN (2019, 2020)
),
paired AS (
    SELECT
        b2019.country_name,
        b2019.net_lending_pct_gdp AS value_2019,
        b2020.net_lending_pct_gdp AS value_2020,
        (b2020.net_lending_pct_gdp - b2019.net_lending_pct_gdp) AS change_2020_minus_2019
    FROM balance b2019
    JOIN balance b2020
      ON b2019.country_name = b2020.country_name
     AND b2019.year = 2019
     AND b2020.year = 2020
)
SELECT
    country_name,
    value_2019,
    value_2020,
    change_2020_minus_2019
FROM paired
ORDER BY change_2020_minus_2019 ASC
LIMIT 1
original_question: Find the country with the largest deterioration in net lending/borrowing (as percent of GDP) during 2019-2020

question: Compare government revenue and expenditure as percent of GDP for Australia across all available years, showing the fiscal balance (revenue minus expenditure)
ground_truth_sql:
SELECT
    g.year,
    SUM(CASE WHEN i.indicator_name = 'Revenue, Transactions (cash basis of recording), Cash basis' THEN g.value ELSE 0 END) AS revenue_pct_gdp,
    SUM(CASE WHEN i.indicator_name = 'Expenditure, Transactions (cash basis of recording), Cash basis' THEN g.value ELSE 0 END) AS expenditure_pct_gdp,
    SUM(CASE WHEN i.indicator_name = 'Revenue, Transactions (cash basis of recording), Cash basis' THEN g.value ELSE 0 END) -
    SUM(CASE WHEN i.indicator_name = 'Expenditure, Transactions (cash basis of recording), Cash basis' THEN g.value ELSE 0 END) AS fiscal_balance
FROM gfs_observations g
JOIN countries c ON g.country_id = c.country_id
JOIN sectors s ON g.sector_id = s.sector_id
JOIN indicators i ON g.indicator_id = i.indicator_id
WHERE c.country_name = 'Australia'
    AND s.sector_name = 'General government'
    AND g.transformation = 'Percent of GDP'
    AND i.indicator_name IN ('Revenue, Transactions (cash basis of recording), Cash basis', 
                             'Expenditure, Transactions (cash basis of recording), Cash basis')
GROUP BY g.year
HAVING SUM(CASE WHEN i.indicator_name = 'Revenue, Transactions (cash basis of recording), Cash basis' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) > 0
   AND SUM(CASE WHEN i.indicator_name = 'Expenditure, Transactions (cash basis of recording), Cash basis' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) > 0
ORDER BY g.year
original_question: Compare government revenue and expenditure as percent of GDP for Australia across all available years, showing the fiscal balance (revenue minus expenditure)
